facts.fact: Black History Month was first celebrated in 1926 as 'Negro History Week'.
In 1976, the week-long celebration was expanded to a month.
The NAACP was founded in 1909 and has played a crucial role in fighting for civil rights.
The first African American to win an Oscar was Hattie McDaniel in 1940 for her role in 'Gone with the Wind'.
Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech in 1963 during the March on Washington.
